website_summaries.verdict: Standout features here include the nonstick surfaces on the pot and pan and the heat-resistant handles. The tea kettle is also a great addition.
pros: 10-piece set comes with a pot, frying pan, tea kettle, 2 stainless steel cups, and a variety of utensils and extras
Pot and pan are made from a teflon-coated aluminum alloy
Total weight of kit is 2.1 lb
Cups are double-walled so you can easily hold them when hot
cons: The silverware locks don't stay in place on some of these
they keep folding up when in use
Not all pieces will fit together into one compact unit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the best products I ever bought on amazon. It’s lightweight, easy to clean, pack and use. I can’t believe I got it for such a low price too!! Will but again definitely but don’t think I would need to for years to come for its excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Komal Redu

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the low price fool you! Amazing quality cookware set!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to receiving my order, I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about the quality of my Camping Cookware. Once received and unboxed, I was beyond satisfied with the quality of each individual piece. From the pan size, to the pot and kettles capacity, and even the utensils are sturdy and durable. The set of cookware comes in a nice mesh bag with drawstring and its overall compactness is impressive. I'll definitely be buying more sets in the future for my son, family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: The little pot set that could
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to test this out in the outdoors but works pretty good on the stove. Was able to cook spaghetti in the pot, a chicken breast, bacon, and eggs in the pan, and boil water for ramen in a cup as well as for coffee using kettle. Silverware work great as well. Still haven't used the cups but from what I can tell will also be good.
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for backpackers!
customer_reviews.text: Worked amazing for my week long trip into the BWCA. Cooked over a open fire and they held up like a champ! Can’t complain! The big pot looks small but will cook enough food for 2 people and still had extra room! The little tea kettle is awesome for warming up water quickly. The spoon knife and fork were garbage but for the price I’m am extremely satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used them yet but they seem sturdy and came just as described despite coming in a box that shows a different set on the front. The teapot was a bit bigger than I expected which is nice. It all fits together nicely in the mesh bag. Update: tried them out on a Coghlans stove and it works perfectly! Doesn’t stick like my last set did. Made pancakes just had to move the pan around a lot because the flame was so small. Boiled water for coffee too! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Small system that is perfect for solo hike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooking set for camping or day hiking trips. It is light and compact and has everything you need to make a meal. If you buy a 220 g/7.75 oz blended fuel cylinder it will fit right in the pots with everything else. ( I don't use the bottle opener/ cork puller, so I don't have it in with the set. ) I would highly recommend this product to keep on you while camping, hiking, fishing or hunting. Basically if you spend full days in the woods this is worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Enos KRISTI

customer_reviews.title: Great little cookware set!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool cookware set. I don't use it for backpacking so i'm not concerned about weight, but it is very light. It was in it's own box inside of the shipping box with other items and when i looked at the box the picture on it was not what i had ordered. When i removed it from the box i saw that it was the correct item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little set for two
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a car camping trip this weekend and LOVED it. The tea pot made the perfect amount of water for our camping French press. So, we had fresh ground hot delicious coffee in the middle of nowhere! The cups were the perfect size to have a little coffee at a time. The pot would be great for soup but I used it to heat up some water for a wash basin. It was great washing with hot water. A small luxury that made a big difference this cold weekend.
customer_reviews.author: SVinLV

customer_reviews.title: Odoland Camping cookware
customer_reviews.text: Overall not a bad cookware for 1 person.... cooks boils and does what it's suppose to... utensils are a bit flimsy but you get what you pay for.. overall not bad for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best set I've had, but ok
customer_reviews.text: The pot, pan, kettle, and cups are nice. All feel pretty sturdy, except the handles get a bit warm and this could have been prevented with better design in materials. The silverware is garbage. The locks don't stay in place, therefore the silverware is constantly folding over. Also beware that this product may come in a box labeled as a different, smaller set. Check the contents first, it's likely the right set. The first set I received was like this. Without opening it I exchanged it and get the same thing again, still in the wrong box. I went ahead and opened it and found that the box is wrong, but the contents are right.
customer_reviews.author: Quaxo

customer_reviews.title: Don't BUY UNSAFE!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Amazon NEVER Refunded me the money for this horrendous thing. Do not buy this! This can not be used over a flame. It is completely defective. The utensils are as good as cheap plastic cutlery. Mine arrived missing one cup the mesh bag was ripped as well. The kettle and pot are the same quality as a kids cooking set. Just don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: DiaperBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Most compact, lightweight, functional cookware set for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Highly reccomend! Everything your need. Light weight. Easy to pack! Great addition to my trip
customer_reviews.author: Tim Dewhirst

customer_reviews.title: TEA POT TOO SMALL! SIZE NOT IN DESCRIPTION
customer_reviews.text: I had to pay $7.90 to return the product even though I’m a prime member. No where in the product description did it give the size of the teapot. It is only .8 L and I needed larger since my French press holds a bit over 1 liter.
customer_reviews.author: Riki

customer_reviews.title: Used these on a 5 day camping trip and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a 5 day camping trip and they worked perfectly with my can of propane and mini camp stove!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Cute...but disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I will start with the positive. I love the finish and especially the kettle! I find it so cute and very useful! Bought this for our camping trip, and realized the utensils would always fold when I used it (esp. the spoon). The pots are good too. However, one of the handles wouldn’t stay in place. It kept swinging back. I was disappointed. :(
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A.

customer_reviews.title: Camp cooking made simple
customer_reviews.text: Great cookware set along with being lightweight and compact. I really love the small kettle for making coffee and heating up water to clean the dirty dishes. That is the main reason I purchased this kit as opposed to those without a kettle. This kit actually save space in my saddle bags as to what I was carrying before. Love It! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Stony Monday

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for our camping trip and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the product. I specifically chose this set because of the teapot. It easily made two cups of coffee. The handle stayed cool to the touch, even when set over an open flame. The pans worked great and cleaned easily. The utensils were cheap, but they were a bonus and so I didn't care about them. I already had a good set of them. Everything fit in the bag provided. I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice for camping
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a set of cooking pans for the just in case scenarios and camping. Just got pack from camping and these worked just fine. No open fire this weekend but used them on propane stove for making coffee, tea and meals. Very compact and small but handy when you don't want the bulky items taking up room. Handles seemed to be something you need to be caution of, as they are useful, but might break is your too aggressive with them. All items fit into each other and fits in a mesh sack. Great item. Happy I got them. I recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: One of these is essential.
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of brands of there, mostly all the same thing. I picked this one for the items included, plus the price. Cookware is sturdy, for bug out, camping stuff. Small footprint, and versatile. Lightweight, in your pack. I'd buy it again, for another pack.
customer_reviews.author: GibsonMarshall

customer_reviews.title: It will come in handy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I make wooden rocket stoves, and felt a meant for camping set of pans would come in handy. Already tried them out, only thing I didn't like was the pan wasn't as nonstick as I would have liked. But this is not my first rodeo, if your camping in general, most gas stations should have margarine that will make this pan nonstick. I did test that out on the pan as well, so margarine+pan= nonstick. Not bad for the cheap price I got it for however.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Beginner or Casual Camper!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this set is fanstastic for a beginner or casual hiker! Its weight is light and durable; I love the addition of a kettle for your hot water/coffee/tea as well. My only gripe about the product is that the handles are wobbly and cheaply attached. I could see that becoming a burn hazard if the handles were to slip out of place while holding and flip the pan/pot with scolding hot food on the person using it.
customer_reviews.author: DarkSideDelight

customer_reviews.title: Cant best the value
customer_reviews.text: Good product , love that the kettle holds just enough water (2 cups)for a freezdried meal, or instant coffee . The little stainless cups are nice quality, I wish it was one slightly larger cup, but not a big deal. The utensils are good in theory, but in the field the locking mechanism tends to come undone, mildly annoying, but not a deal breaker. I would recommend this product, and I will buy from this manufacturer again
customer_reviews.author: lfreda

customer_reviews.title: Typical knockoff gear
customer_reviews.text: Mostly as expected. Cheap pack cook set that does it's job. Dediy NOT non stick so bring oil/butter. It does clean up easily and I really like the kettle. Not a fan of the silverware, definitely not stainless. In fact it's started rust almost immediately but I paid about $20 for the whole set so still decent for it's intended function.
customer_reviews.author: The Broke Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Best for the Price
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal. Used this on kayak camping trip. Wow.Great product to use for first time backpackers. Cheap and durable. Outstanding value. Lightweight, easy to pack, burner worked flawlessly and the whole package is simply unbeatable. Much cheaper than high end brand names and served well on a rainy 3 day backpacking adventure. Depended on it and it didn't let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Barba Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Does not Nest!  but pretty good otherwise
customer_reviews.text: So you assume with any portable camping cookware set like this that everything fits inside the pot. They do not. It does not best as implied. Good bargain for what you get, but you will have to pick and choose what you want to bring, or just be ok with the lid not closing. If I’d known this when I bought it would have been a deal breaker. If you remove one cup you can make it work. Or if you don’t bring your kettle you have room for a light Pocket rocket style stove and a small container of fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Item not delivered as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive the item purchased. There is no tea pot, cups or silverware. It is only the cookware and not the other supplies advertised
customer_reviews.author: S. Mck

customer_reviews.title: nice budget kit. Pot volume is not 1.9l more like 1.2-4l
customer_reviews.text: This is a good kit, not the lightest but crazy cheap. I love the kettle the most! The lid falls off easy so be careful with the pot. The pot holds safely maybe 1200ml or at absolute fullest 1400ml. The cups are nice but tiny and heavyish. All in all a great option if you aren't counting ounces and not worried about the fanciest stuff. I've used these in the tropics and high mountains and it's done well on fire and cook stoves.
customer_reviews.author: tnhg

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact set!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for two! Light weight and space saving. My husband and I took this set to camping and used it quite a bit to heat water and food. Wish it came with 2 cutlery set instead of 1. Kind of weird that it came with 2 cups but only 1 cutlery set.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: An incredibly effective and affordable cook set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an impromptu camping trip and was incredibly surprised with the quality and all of the extras. I’be backpacked extensively and used many different cookware sets, and this little one gives many of the $100+ ones a run for their money. It’s not titanium or suitable for ultralight camping, but for chill backpacking or camping (solo or two people max) these work great. Admittedly, I didn’t use the fry pan, but the heat conduction on the pan was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Elan Green

customer_reviews.title: Not non stick
customer_reviews.text: We could barely cook anything in these pans besides boiling water. Everything stuck on the pan bad.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Liudahl

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpacking set
customer_reviews.text: Great little mess kit. I bought this to simplify my bulky mess kit for a trip into the grand canyon. Love that it is so small and simple. Worked great on my butane stove.
customer_reviews.author: Denton

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't fit securely with cups when packed up
customer_reviews.text: This is light weight and not overly bulky. It will be a great addition for our adult patrol on Boy Scout camping trips. I give it 4 stars because if you keep the cups with the kit, the pot lid doesn't sit flush when all packed together so you get some noise. Not a real big issue because I carry an insulated cup anyway and removed these from the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Great but small
customer_reviews.text: I wish the items were a bit bigger. I love the items received. Great for 1 person, maybe 2. Not good for a family unless you want to keep repeating.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Reed

customer_reviews.title: Go with the standard set
customer_reviews.text: Clocking set will Really got the five stars, but other accessories really are not usable and the cups are same size of the espresso shots. May be better to go just with standard version and save your $$$
customer_reviews.author: Salar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little compact camping set
customer_reviews.text: Love this little set! Came complete with everything we needed. I love how compact it gets and fits back into the little mesh bag. I love that the two little cups are insulated and don’t feel hot to the touch while holding the outside of it! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Belale

customer_reviews.title: Came with broken pot lid
customer_reviews.text: I got these right before a camping trip. Upon opening it, I immediately noticed that the pot lid’s small handle at the top was broken off and the lid was dented. Everything else was still usable so I never exchanged it. Everything in the kit does the job, but I’m disappointed that something I bought new arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Joana

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a family
customer_reviews.text: Why to small... and couldn't get the cups to fit in the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Garland

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive cookset
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well on the campfire. Everything packed well and seems durable. Pans are not non stick, eggs stuck like glue and was hard to clean. A small inconvenience for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Could be a great
customer_reviews.text: The set looks nice online and when it arrived. Tea pot and cups worked great but the pot and pan food stuck to the bottom like nobody's business (to make a batch of pancakes it took 1/2 of shortening in the pan, and still wasn't enough). Prob work great for foods with liquid in them (beans, veggies, oatmeal) and will have to try it. For now I'll carry a nonstick frying pan with me...
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: fits in my pack
customer_reviews.text: Great little kit for my hammock setup! I can boil water for dehydrated meals or cook something a little fancier in the pans. The none stick coating makes clean up fast and easy. It is small enough to fit in my pack with out hogging all the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap as it comes. It might get you out of a pinch one day so I won't say don't buy it. It's difficult to find anything of any real quality in today's world.
customer_reviews.author: The Drifter

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Packs up nice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mess kit. Everything packs up small, and works quite well. I look forward to using this on many campouts!
customer_reviews.author: Franklin T. Welter

customer_reviews.title: Small, but easy to carry.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cookware for a solo camper, but that's what I bought it for anyway. Combine it with a small stick stove and you will be happy with it. Easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Really an excellent camp kitchen set only disappointing feature is that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Really an excellent camp kitchen set only disappointing feature is that it doesn’t all fit inside each other as I thought when I purchased it. However, it does all fit in the carrying bag as advertised I just didn’t realize the cups were sticking out and the lid didn’t fit flush when packed up. All in all worked excellent, all I need for everything I cooked on the trail, light and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose well
customer_reviews.text: Serves the purpose well and packs compactly. Took off one star because handles are loose, would be better if they could just snap into place. A good buy at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and compact
customer_reviews.text: Warning - pans are not non-stick. Brought enchiladas camping and it totally stuck to the pan. Aside from that, Everything else worked great. Cups for a little hot when boiling water was added.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: CAMPING COOKWARE
customer_reviews.text: NOT USED SO FAR, I PURCHASED COOKWARE AND ADDED TO SURVIVAL KIT I SET UP FOR MY DAUGHTER AND GRANDKIDS. ALL LOOKED GOOD AND HOPING THEY NEVER USE IT FOR SURVIVING.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Check your cups for black residue
customer_reviews.text: I washed the cups before my trip and noticed that there were black spots so I rewashed and after drying found that when i run my fingers along the rim, black residue comes off. Not sure what's wrong with these cups, but I don't trust them to drink from. Haven't tried the pots yet, but a little concerned about how safe they are.
customer_reviews.author: Chanthyna C Chhay

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fit in a backpack or kayak. It’s very light weight and useful to carry while camping or hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: Having issues putting it back together so it fits into one nice and neat package. Probably my inability to solve it more than anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Grad

customer_reviews.title: Small, great, very useful
customer_reviews.text: This was a awesome kit! Worked great while camping and small and compact!
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the price
customer_reviews.text: cheap enough to gamble on. Bought it, used it, love it. very light. comes with travel bag. silverware kinda useless, but everything else is nice. I would definitely buy another kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packs a lot in a little space
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine set, it's small and light but that's the point. Heated up water for tea in 60 seconds on mini propane stove.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had two sets of the knife and fork but other than that its a great little set for the price
customer_reviews.text: I picked this set up to add to my basic camping items for overland trips. It had all the essentials I needed for making food etc for my self and one person. Wish it had two sets of the knife and fork but other than that its a great little set for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Complete kit
customer_reviews.text: Metal cups and metal utensils along with the tea kettle complete a compact and sturdy set.
customer_reviews.author: George Couper

customer_reviews.title: It's the real Deal.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered sets like this that were lies , yours however is PERFECT ,its exactly as described and photos upon purchase , thank you , I will shop with you again.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny b

customer_reviews.title: What is this made of?
customer_reviews.text: Emergency? Fine. But don't do this to yourself if you can help it. Go invest in a nice set made completely of stainless steel. Its healthier and you won't have to worry about lead in the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality, as long as talent care of product will last very long, do not use in dish washer and non stick coating will last for a long time
customer_reviews.author: matt whelan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the cookware. It is the perfect size for backpacking. The product looks well constructed and came as described in the item description.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camping pots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome , light weigh, easy to clean and storage. I loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any camping adventure!
customer_reviews.text: This little kit is perfect for out college aged daughter. Her friends love to camp out often and this set is perfect. Compact and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Grande

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done. I put them through hell and they came out scorched but ultimately fine.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: durable, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not use the set yet it appears to be of good quality. I'm sure of ease of cleaning due to the finish on them inside and out. I have other cookware with very similiar finish and love how they clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Pbhreggie

customer_reviews.title: Everything was great about this product but both cups do not fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great about this product but both cups do not fit into the unit. I couls only fir one cup and able to close the top lid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We had expected to head out for a weekend for camping and hoped it would be good enough for cooking without any extra cookware
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and returned. We had expected to head out for a weekend for camping and hoped it would be good enough for cooking without any extra cookware. This is good enough for one person for a simple food warmup.
customer_reviews.author: VeryPicky

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact set.
customer_reviews.text: I can't get the set to go Back into the proper nesting positions to close back together again once removed. Instructions are less than helpful
customer_reviews.author: Gloveman248

customer_reviews.title: Well made cook set
customer_reviews.text: I am excited to use this cook set for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't close
customer_reviews.text: This little kit would be perfect if the lid would snap vlose with all the utensils in it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey McCready

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Used for a motorcycle camping trip. Very compact, lightweight and user friendly.This cookset worked great on a backcountry mountain hunt. Water boiled very fast, the burner was light but efficient, and the snap open "canister supporter" made it easy to level out the stove on uneven terrain. I only used the pots for water, oatmeal, and coffee but the finish held up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Singer Kendra

customer_reviews.title: looks good,
customer_reviews.text: Ill have to use this to know its durability and how easy to clean, but it seems to be what I need.
customer_reviews.author: james w sommese

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Kit Following An Earthquake
customer_reviews.text: This item was a gift for a family member. It has not been used yet. The purpose of its use will be for camping or for temporary survival following our 6.4 and 7.1 earthquakes this past July 4th and 5th, 2019 here in California.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret C. Hopfer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set. Bring a spork.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely set. Nice and light. Don't count on the utensils being super useful. But the set is great in general.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but small for 2 people.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for camping for me and my wife. Didn't realize how small the cookware was, but seems like just enough for two people. Any more people, you would definitely need something larger. The benefit is that it is very compact and easily attached on to your backpack via a nice carabiner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping with 2 people
customer_reviews.text: This was great for camping! I used the tea kettle to boil water for my coffee & the pots and pans were a little more difficult to clean however that's because I cooked baked beans in them over the fire and nothing is easy to clean at a campsite! Happy I bought this
customer_reviews.author: Roger Mosley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this for his scout camping and hiking trips. Makes thing alot easier for him to cook with
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Zwick

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Very light weight and easy to store due to its size.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I do not have disliked for this product. Actually, I am happy with my purchase. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Boy

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used these to cook and eat from for a week. They maintained well against rain (no rust), and no burn marks from my camp stove. I only cooked freeze dried food in them, so not sure how they’d hold up against real meat or eggs. Cleaned out easily after use. The folding silverware is legit, very durable. I’d buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: The stove adapter was so awesome and useful.We absolutely love this kit! I am extremely satisfied what I have. My main purpose was to get this for emergencies only. But me and my kids went to the beach last weekend and bought a very small grill to cook hamburgers and hot dogs on the beach. This camping cookware came in very handy and has good quality of this product
customer_reviews.author: Deleon Brenna

customer_reviews.title: definitely reccomend
customer_reviews.text: This was my first lightweight cook set for hiking / camping. I love this lightweight cook system. I forgot to take pictures of it on my last camping trip but who needs more pics of this? There are already plenty. Customer service is a big deal to me and they didn't hesitate to take care of me. So many companies are hit and miss now days. Glad to find one I can trust!
customer_reviews.author: wooten joyce

customer_reviews.title: So excited
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought so definitely only for single person camping
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Pack
customer_reviews.text: Durable product placed kettle directly on hot coals worked well hard to clean outside without scratching, magic eraser works well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Justice

customer_reviews.title: Compact set
customer_reviews.text: Worked out nice for a Christmas gifts for beginner campers.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our one-two day hikes. Bring your own spork 😎
customer_reviews.author: Ric D.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price, and performed well. The cups are SO small though, and everything doesn't fit flush together unless you take the cups out.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I've used all the pieces at least once, they are easy to use, they heat up quick and are easy to clean up. All the pieces fit within in each other for easy storage with the exception of the cups. I can't figure out how to put them both in the kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid set.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this set not long ago, haven't had the chance to test it out yet. From what I can tell it's a solid set, everything was there. Can't wait to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pans are good quality, non-stick
customer_reviews.text: The pans are good quality, non-stick, but the spoon, fork, and knife are not so good. The spoon stained after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Yu

customer_reviews.title: No mess here unexpected quality.
customer_reviews.text: Go Bag ready, neat and tidy. Nothing likes quick hot tea.
customer_reviews.author: Birder

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product, but the mesh didn’t hold up through our camping trip. Good product, but maybe get a separate mesh lining for it
customer_reviews.author: Max Major

customer_reviews.title: Very nice outdoor cooking gear
customer_reviews.text: Very nice outdoor cooking gear, products came as shown, the quality of the materias feel sturdy, I am very pleased with my purchase and the lightweight stove works very nice.This was great. Love the little spatula too! The size of this kit is amazing. This whole kit was what I used for cooking and eating out of. Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This set is almost perfect. I'd give 5 stars but one of my pot handles was shipped to me loose and swings around when I pick it up. Other than that everything is lightweight and a great size.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Derby

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it was supposed to be cleaned in a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.text: After cleaning, the material seemed to be almost chalk-like. Very unlikely to use again.
customer_reviews.author: dirtybirdz520

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet, but quality seems to be good
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to using this product, will update after first use of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Sturtz

customer_reviews.title: Good camping gear
customer_reviews.text: The pots cups, and kettle are pretty good. The rest of the stuff is kinda cheep.
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: SUPER COOL COOKING SET
customer_reviews.text: GOOD quality and light weight. Only for 2-3 persons since it's quite small size.
customer_reviews.author: Guangle Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Loved
customer_reviews.text: Used it camping upstate NY and I loved how convenient it all was
customer_reviews.author: Belledonna Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Great portable set
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and convenient. Used it for a 10 day car camping roadtrip. Worked over fire and on Coleman camping grill.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping trip
customer_reviews.text: this was perfect for what we needed - compact, easy to carry and worked well. Liked that there is a kettle and small cups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: can be used at home and camping
customer_reviews.text: like that it was all compact easy to store oh my bicycle motorcycle
customer_reviews.author: lucas hernandez

product_meta.title: Odoland 10pcs Camping Cookware Mess Kit, Lightweight Pot Pan Kettle with 2 Cups, Fork Knife Spoon Kit for Backpacking, Outdoor Camping Hiking and Picnic
feature_bullets: Best Money Ever Spent: The 10 pieces hiking cooking gear includes 1 aluminum non-stick pot + 1 aluminum non-stick frying pan + 1 tea kettle+ 2 stainless steel cups (4 oz) + 1 serving spoon+ 1 fork + 1 knife + 1 carabiner + 1 carrying bag.
Heat-Resistant Handles: Thermally insulated plastic handles keep your fingers safe from the heat; anti-slip design offers a firm and comfortable grip in your hands.
Non-Stick & Incredibly Durable: Each piece has a non-stick Teflon coating for easy cleaning and durability. It conducts heat quickly and is a must-have survival gear that built to last for long time.
Easy to Carry: Foldable handles on pot or stove can be folded to save space. Small size and portable, all the objects in this cooking set can be stored together in a mesh bag for convenient carry.

Enjoy Cooking Anywhere You Go: This awesome cookware kit is designed for anyone loves outdoor camping with families and friends! It is super-portable, making it much more convenient for camping, hiking, backpacking, picnic and other outdoor activities!
